definition[1]: someone who buys new shares in a company in order to sell them quickly and make a profit, rather than to keep them as an investment
definition[2]: to buy shares in a company in order to sell them quickly and make a profit, rather than to keep them as an investment
example[0]: Substantially reducing the pricing of the tender  (=formal statement of the price) makes it unpopular with those who like to stag new issues.
